thread.title: CFO Moves: Diago, Essentra, HP, Advance Publications, [24]7.ai and RBS

author: Tatyana Shumsky
title: CFO Moves: Diago, Essentra, HP, Advance Publications, [24]7.ai and RBS
text:
0 COMMENTS CFOs on the move. Photo: THE WALL STREET JOURNAL
Diago PLC , the U.K. spirits maker, named Lavanya Chandrashekar as chief financial officer of its North America division, effective July 1 . Ms. Chandrashekar joins from Mondelez International Inc., where she most recently held regional CFO roles in both EMEA and North America. Compensation details were not immediately available.
Essentra PLC , a U.K.-based maker of plastic, fibre, foam, and packaging products, has appointed Lily Liu as CFO, effective Nov. 15 . Ms. Liu succeeds the company’s current CFO Stefan Schellinger who is set to leave Essentra on Nov. 30 . Prior to her appointment, Ms. Liu served as finance chief at Xaar PLC, an inkjet printing technology group. Compensation details were not immediately available.
HP Inc., the Palo Alto, Calif. printer and personal-computer maker, named Steve Fieler as chief financial officer, effective July 1 . Mr. Fieler succeeds Cathie Lesjak, who will assume the role of interim chief operating officer which she plans to hold until her retirement, planned for early 2019.
Ms. Lesjak has served as CFO at HP since 2007, until the company separation in November 2015, when she became CFO of HP Inc. She has held a range of leadership roles during her 32 years at the company. Ms. Lesjak’s compensation will not change as a result of her transition.
Mr. Fieler has served as global head of treasury since January 2017, when he rejoined the company. Prior to that, he served as CFO at Proteus Digital Health Inc. since 2014.
Mr. Fieler will receive a base salary of $690,000 and a cash bonus targeted at 125% of his base salary. He also receives a one-time $2 million equity award consisting of 40% restricted stock units vesting annually over three years and 60% performance adjusted stock units. according to a filing.
Advance Publications Inc., the New York media company, named Oren Klein as chief financial officer, effective Oct. 1 . He succeeds Tom Summer, who had previously said he will retire. Mr. Summer will remain at the company through the end of 2018 and then assume the role of senior advisor. Mr. Klein was most recently controller and vice president finance, a role he held since 2008. Prior to joining Advance, Mr. Klein held various executive positions at Pitney Bowes Inc. Compensation details were not immediately available.
[24] 7.ai Inc., a San Jose, Calif. customer engagement technology maker, named Brent Bowman finance chief. He was most recently CFO of Intel Corp.’s programmable solutions business, Altera Corp.
Royal Bank of Scotland PLC , a U.K.-based bank, said its Chief Financial Officer Ewen Stevenson is resigning to take up another opportunity outside the company. The effective date of departure for Mr. Stevenson will be confirmed in due course, the bank said. It has commenced the search for a successor.
